translations.translation: The people who have taqwa will be in a safe place
Surely those who fear and follow the straight path will be in a place of peace and security
Verily the God-fearing shall be in a secure place
The pious ones will be in a secure place
Indeed the pious are in a place of peace.
Verily, those who have Taqwa, will be in place of security.
Surely those who guard (against evil) are in a secure place,
Surely the godfearing shall be in a station secure
Lo! those who kept their duty will be in a place secured.
But those mindful of God will be in a safe place,
Verily the God-fearing will be in a place secure
Indeed the Godwary will be in a safe place,
As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security,
Verily! The Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2), will be in place of Security (Paradise).
Indeed, for those who feared (Allah) is a secure place
As for the righteous, they will be in a secure place.
Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place;
[44:51] Assuredly the God-fearing will be in a secure place, a seat in which there will be security from [all] fear,
(Lo! those who kept their duty) those who ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies, i.e. Abu Bakr and his believing brothers, (will be in a place secure) a place safe from death, ruin or torment

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: يقول الحق جلّ جلاله: { إِنَّ المتقين في مقامٍ } بضم الميم: مصدر، أي: في إقامة حسنة، وبالفتح: اسم مكان، أي: في مكان كريم، وأصل المقام، بالفتح: موضع القيام، ثم عمّم واستعمل في جميع الأمكنة، حتى قيل لموضع القعود: مقام، وإن لم يقم فيه أصلاً، ويقال: كنا في مقام فلان، أي: مجلسه، فهو من الخاص الذي وقع مستعملاً في معنى العموم، وقوله: { أمين } وصف له، أي: يأمن صاحبُه الآفات والانتقال عنه، وهو من الأمن ضد الخيانة، وصف به المكان مجازاً، لأن المكان المخيف يخون صاحبه بما يلقى فيه من المكاره
